Key Arguments: The bill represents censorship and is a threat to democracy, society, economy, wellbeing, and safety.
The bill could lead to the silencing of dissenting voices and control of information by the government.
Misinformation and disinformation are subjective terms and should not be controlled by the government.
The bill could lead to unlawful surveillance and bypass privacy laws.
The ACMA is an unelected body and should not have the power to control speech.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is a threat to our democracy. We must have the freedom to discuss any and every topic for better understanding.
Misinformation and disinformation are relative terms.
The ACMA is an unelected body. It is unaccountable to the people of Australia and so should have no power to control what we see or say.
